trustfund:
TF095759-GAMBIA - Agriculture Production
            Project P119892,TF096106-Emergency Agriculture
            Production Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Agriculture
            Production Project for Gambia were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was satisfactory and grantee performance was
            also satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: lack of
            effective sensitization and adequate human resource in
            implementing institutions hinder delivery of emergency
            operations. Less complex and simply designed projects that
            also take into consideration the institutional capacities of
            the country is more likely to be successful. Interventions
            that help to mitigate climate change effects, such as
            adverse weather, would help boost production and alleviate
            poverty of beneficiaries. Close monitoring of annual plans
            as well as approved procurement plans are critical to
            completing emergency projects of this nature. It can be
            problematic using short-term emerging funding for long-term
            funding activities. The administrative agreements should
            clearly define reporting chain as well as the
            responsibilities of the Bank to the European Union (EU)
            delegation operating in the recipient countries.
